intro: Cirsium anartiolepis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved thistle, is a perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its spiny, lobed leaves and purple to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its flowering period occurs in late summer to early autumn, attracting various pollinators. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
